cli

Class Setup

  • java.lang.Object
    • cli.Setup

  • public class Setup
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Setup used to do initial game setup: obtain number of players, player names and save files

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Game game
      Game that we will setup

      java.lang.String name1Def,
      java.lang.String name2Def,
      java.lang.String file1Def,
      java.lang.String file2Def)
        Instantiates a new setup
        Parameters:
        scan - scanner used to get input from the console
        name1Def - default name for player 1
        name2Def - default name for player 2
        file1Def - default file for player 1
        file2Def - default file for player 2

      • inputNames

        private void inputNames(java.util.Scanner scan,
                        java.lang.String name1Def,
                        java.lang.String name2Def)
        Gets the player names from the console
        Parameters:
        scan - scanner used to get input from the console
        name1Def - default name for player 1 in case an empty name is chosen
        name2Def - default name for player 2 in case an empty name is chosen

      • inputFiles

        private void inputFiles(java.util.Scanner scan,
                        java.lang.String file1Def,
                        java.lang.String file2Def)
        Gets the player files from the console
        Parameters:
        scan - scanner used to get input from the console
        file1Def - default path for the file of player 1 in case an empty file is chosen
        file2Def - default path for the file of player 2 in case an empty file is chosen

      • setPlayerFile

        private java.lang.String setPlayerFile(java.util.Scanner scan,
                                       java.lang.String number,
                                       java.lang.String fileDef)
        Gets a given player file from the console
        Parameters:
        scan - scanner used to get input from the console
        number - number of the player whose file we want to get
        fileDef - default file path
        Returns:
        string with the path to the player file
